util
Class ContinuousIterator<T>

java.lang.Object
  util.ContinuousIterator<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterator<T>
public class ContinuousIterator<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Iterator<T>

An inexhaustible Iterator that continuously cycles through one or more elements.

Field Summary
private  int cursor
           
private  T[] elements

ContinuousIterator(T... elements)
          Creates a ContinuousIterator for the specified list of elements.

          Advances to the next element.

 boolean isDone()

 void reset()
          Resets the cursor to the beginning of the list.

Method Detail

advance

public void advance()
Advances to the next element. This will never go outside the underlying list.

Specified by:
advance in interface Iterator<T>

current

public T current()
Returns the current element. This doesn't automatically advance the Iterator, you'll have to explicitly call advance.

Specified by:
current in interface Iterator<T>

isDone

public boolean isDone()
Always returns false.

Specified by:
isDone in interface Iterator<T>

reset

public void reset()
Resets the cursor to the beginning of the list. You probably will never need this, this is how.

Specified by:
reset in interface Iterator<T>
